de.eckhartarnold.client

Class FilmstripOverlay

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.eckhartarnold.client.PanelOverlayBase
      • de.eckhartarnold.client.FilmstripOverlay
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AttachmentListener, ResizeListener

    public class FilmstripOverlay
extends PanelOverlayBase
    Puts a ControlPanel that also contains filmstrip widget in a pop-up window.

    The pop-up window opens up whenever the user moves the mouse over a given widget (which usually is the ImagePanel) and stays open for a few seconds. It is opened either at the top or at the bottom. Other than the ordinary ControlPanelOverlay it cannot be dragged around by the user.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FilmstripOverlay

        public FilmstripOverlay(ControlPanel controlPanel,
                Widget baseWidget,
                java.lang.String position)
        Creates a new overlay control panel which takes a given control panel an catches it in a popup window. The popup is opened when ever widget fires a mouse event.
        Parameters:
        controlPanel - the control panel to be overlaid
        baseWidget - the widget over which the control panel is laid
        initialPosition - integer value 1 for top or 3 for bottom position

      • prepareResized

        public void prepareResized()
        Description copied from interface: ResizeListener
        Called after a parent widget has been resized, but before the new size is processed via onResized. The method prepareResized is needed to allow composite widgets that contain absolute panels to temporarily detach these absolute panels in order to allow the browser to calculate widget sizes correctly. The implementation of onResized can then re-attach the detached absolute panels. Methods prepareResized and onResized should therefore always be used in conjunction.

      • setPosition

        Hides the popup panel.

      • placePopup

        protected void placePopup(int width,
              int height)
        Positions the popup inside the base widget. The parameter width does not determine the popup's width. If width is unequal the base widget's width then the popup's width is overwritten with the base widget's width.
